project1.title: React Sports Roster
project1.description: This project was the first application I built using React. It displays a roster of players associated with an authenticated user and allows the user to perform full CRUD. Go Titans!

project2.title: Pinterest Clone
project2.description: I built this Pinterest clone for an NSS class assignment in order to practice making Axios API calls to Firebase. Users first login using their Google accounts and then can create, delete, and update boards with individual pins related to their interests.
project2.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, Sass, JavaScript, jQuery, Axios, Firebase

project3.title: Chatty App
project3.description: The chatty app is a messaging app I contributed to for a group project at NSS. It allows a user to select who is sending a message, submit a new message, and perform specific actions such as liking and disliking messages, deleting messages, and selecting app styles.
project3.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, Sass, JavaScript, jQuery

project4.title: Tamagotchi
project4.description: Modelled after the 90's Toy, the Tamagotchi project was a NSS class assignment to practice modular development and styling using Sass. Users can alter the calculated scores when clicking buttons in each displayed quadrant.

project5.title: Shark Attack
project5.description: NSS homework project, which introduces the use of Javascript modules. A webpage that displays a grid of cards that show bears. Scientists and park rangers may use this to add and track bears that feed on salmon in a particular river
project5.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, Vanilla JavaScript, Version Control with Github
